messages.message: Is there a way to avoid manual polling of travis builds on personal PRs? Like a bot slack notifications when build completes. How can I set that up?

i think we can execute a shell script as a post-build-task (https://plugins.jenkins.io/postbuild-task/) in jenkins, which can curl slack api with apt params. correct me if i am wrong @Heymian

@abhilash happy to help in setting this up. :slightly_smiling_face:
It would be integrations into Travis, not Jenkins. We haven’t integrated PR pre-merge tests into Jenkins yet.

@abhilash, for slack bot, we will have to maintain a mapping of slack github user-id:user-id somewhere in case you are thinking on lines of sending a notification to a say, #pr-build-status channel :

“@Mohit build for your PR #12345 is success.”
anything would work.. whatever’s easiest to implement
i have a solution, running it by @Heymian.

*update on this:* i tried to add a slack integration, it sends the PR build status to <#C011UUAU9KN|> . But, there is no way to notify PR author because slack’s keyword notifications do not work for bots :disappointed:

*Approach2 in progress…*

slack has been requested this since 2014, but still they cant do keyword notifications for many bots

https://twitter.com/slackhq/status/539914015611580417?lang=en
I have another approach, but travis is down for scheduled maintenance. Will try that tomo.
